alert.note: Alert for Coal; Pontotoc (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued May 15 at 6:27PM CDT until May 15 at 10:00PM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 645 PM CDT FOR NORTHWESTERN COAL AND CENTRAL PONTOTOC COUNTIES... At 627 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located near Stonewall, moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Two inch hail and 60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Trained weather spotters. IMPACT...People and animals outdoors will be injured. Expect hail damage to roofs, siding, windows, and vehicles. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Ada, Stonewall, Tupelo, Fitzhugh, Fittstown and Jesse. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...OBSERVED MAX HAIL SIZE...2.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
